though is an assessment of classification accuracy.:raw-latex:`\n`",
":raw-latex:`\n`", "This is generally done as a `confusion
matrix <http://www.exelisvis.com/docs/CalculatingConfusionMatrices.html>`__.:raw-latex:`\n`",
":raw-latex:`\n`", "In setting this up, you need either to have a ground
truth 'image', or a set of ROIs that can be used for ground
truth.:raw-latex:`\n`", ":raw-latex:`\n`", "You should first generate a
new (independent) set of ROIs (or better still, use random samples) for
your classes. If you use random samples, you can check what you think
the land cover class should be using Google Earth/Maps as
above.:raw-latex:`\n`", ":raw-latex:`\n`", "Once you have your confusion
matrix, make sure that you understand what it is telling you (and as far
as possible, why that is so).:raw-latex:`\n`", ":raw-latex:`\n`", "If
the classification result seems poor, you can go back and edit your
settings or class definitions and re-try, but try to keep the ROIs you
use for checking independent of this process.:raw-latex:`\n`",
":raw-latex:`\n`", "Make sure you understand the terms we use to
describe the different accuracies shown in the confusion matrix, and
also `what a kappa coefficient
is <http://www.exelisvis.com/docs/CalculatingConfusionMatrices.html>`__."
